column1: Manteca is a city in San Joaquin County
column2: California. The city's estimated 2010 US Census population was 67

column1: Manteca is a city in the Central Valley of California
column2: 76 miles east of San Francisco.  It was founded in 1861 by Joshua Cowell. Cowell claimed around 1
column3: 000 acres (4.0 km2) and built houses on what is now the corner of Main and Yosemite
column4: where Bank of America now stands. In 1873
column5: the Central Pacific Railroad laid track directly through the area. The residents wanted to refer to their new train station as "Cowell Station"
column6: but there was already a Cowell Station near Tracy. The residents agreed to change the name of the community
column7: choosing "Monteca" as the new name. This was misprinted as "Manteca" (Spanish for lard) by the railroad
column8: and the misspelled version was eventually accepted as the name of the town. In 1918
column9: Manteca was incorporated as a city
column10: and Joshua Cowell became its first mayor.

column2: photojournalist Dorothea Lange took photos of William & Mary Dimotakis (immigrants from the Greek island of Crete)
column5: on the family farm in Manteca for the Farm Security Administration. The farm
column7: is still owned by the Dimotakis family.

column2: and it lies at a crossroads of major highways and railroads. As recently as the 1970s
column3: Manteca existed primarily on agriculture and was still barely a stop between two freeways
column4: Interstate 5 and State Route 99. The continuing rise in Bay Area housing prices caused Bay Area families to look further eastward for more affordable places to live. Since the construction of the 120 bypass portion of State Route 120
column5: Manteca has become a popular choice for these commuters. The 1990s saw an increase in the city's population and the construction of its third high school Sierra High School
column6: the first two being Manteca High School and East Union High School. The population of Manteca continues to increase
column7: with some housing being constructed on what was once farmland to the north and southeast. Manteca has more than tripled in population since 1980.Manteca is the home base for the "Not Forgotten Memorial Day Event"
column8: the largest commemoration for veterans on the West Coast. The event is held the Sunday before Memorial Day every year. The event draws over 20

column4: 17 year-old Marcos Garcia and 19 year-old Niko Pinkard were at Doxey Park in northwest Manteca when they were shot at near the northeast corner of the park. Marcos Garcia was shot fatally while Niko Pinkard sustained non-life-threatening injuries to his head.

column1: The man who carried out the fatal shooting
column3: was not found out until October 2015
column4: when he went to prison on unrelated charges of unlawful sexual intercourse
column6: and inflicting injury to the parent of a child.

column4: and Tracy. Manteca is located in between the larger cities of Modesto and Stockton.

column1: According to the Köppen Climate Classification system
column2: Manteca has a warm-summer Mediterranean climate
column3: abbreviated "Csa" on climate maps.  It's hot in summer
column5: except during spells of seasonal tule fog
column6: when it can be quite chilly for many days. Summers are dry
column7: winters are rainy with stretches of fair weather.

column1: Manteca Transit Center is the hub of public transit in the city. Local bus service is provided by Manteca Transit.

A commuter rail service is provided by the Altamont Corridor Express (ACE) at the Lathrop/Manteca station – it operates in peak travel directions with trips to San Jose in the morning and to Stockton in the evening. It is expected to be routed directly to the Transit Center by 2023.
Public schools in Manteca are part of the Manteca Unified School District. The school district encompasses the towns of Manteca
column4: and the Weston Ranch community in Stockton.  There are no middle schools; elementary school continues through the 8th grade
column5: with a mix of both year-round and traditional schools. Manteca Unified School District has 19 elementary schools
column7: and 2 continuation schools. Not all of the schools listed below are in Manteca itself.

column1: Paul Wiggin (b. 1934) – former American football player and coach; attended Manteca High School

Congressman John J. McFall (b. 1918)  Served in the United States House of Representatives 1957-1979. Majority Whip and Appropriations Transportation Subcommittee Chairman. Mayor of Manteca and Member of the California State Assembly. Son of Hope McFall who was killed in action in World War I.
On The Road - Jack Kerouac's narrator Sal passes through Manteca: "The sun goes down long and red. All the magic names of the valley unrolled - Manteca..."
